Returns: the string representation of this instance
toString().Description: Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method. The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of:

Returns: true if there is a value present, otherwise false
isPresent().Description: Return true if there is a value present, otherwise false.

empty().Description: Returns an empty OptionalDouble instance. No value is present for this OptionalDouble.

Returns: the value, if present, otherwise other
Parameters: double: the value to be returned if there is no value present
orElse(double).Description: Return the value if present, otherwise return other.

Returns: an OptionalDouble with the value present
Parameters: double: the value to be present
of(double).Description: Return an OptionalDouble with the specified value present.

Parameters: Supplier: The supplier which will return the exception to be thrown
Throws: if there is no value present
if no value is present and exceptionSupplier is null
orElseThrow(java.util.function.Supplier<.Description: Return the contained value, if present, otherwise throw an exception to be created by the provided supplier.

Returns: the value held by this OptionalDouble
Throws: if there is no value present
getAsDouble().Description: If a value is present in this OptionalDouble, returns the value, otherwise throws NoSuchElementException.

Returns: hash code value of the present value or 0 if no value is present
hashCode().Description: Returns the hash code value of the present value, if any, or 0 (zero) if no value is present.

Parameters: DoubleConsumer: block to be executed if a value is present
Throws: if value is present and consumer is null
ifPresent(java.util.function.DoubleConsu.Description: Have the specified consumer accept the value if a value is present, otherwise do nothing.

Returns: {code true} if the other object is "equal to" this object otherwise false
Parameters: Object: an object to be tested for equality
equals(java.lang.Object).Description: Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this OptionalDouble. The other object is considered equal if: it is also an OptionalDouble and; both instances have no value present or; the present values are "equal to" each other via Double.compare() == 0.

Returns: the value if present otherwise the result of other.getAsDouble()
Parameters: DoubleSupplier: a DoubleSupplier whose result is returned if no value is present
Throws: if value is not present and other is null
orElseGet(java.util.function.DoubleSuppl.Description: Return the value if present, otherwise invoke other and return the result of that invocation.

ClassDesc: A container object which may or may not contain a double value. If a value is present, isPresent() will return true and getAsDouble() will return the value. Additional methods that depend on the presence or absence of a contained value are provided, such as @B_java#util#OptionalDouble#orElse_E@ (return a default value if value not present) and @B_java#util#OptionalDouble#ifPresent_E@ (execute a block of code if the value is present).
